content.description:
Set up a top rope at the anchors for this one.

When looking up at the boulder from the trail, this climbs up the right side of the tall slab face, ending at the apex of the boulder. Work your way up the short vertical face and then up the long slab.

Super funtastic. Set up a top rope at the anchors or take a static line with you to descend safely.

Stand Start 8ft right of "Boone Swoon" on nice juggy features. Follow a slightly right trending line up to the tall lip below the "cap rock" at the top. There is some chossy gravel in the back of the upper jugs, but stick to the plentiful jug features and its nice and cruiser.

Set up a top rope at the anchors for this one

When looking up at the boulder from the trail, this climbs up the left side of the tall slab face, ending at the apex of the boulder. Work your way up the short vertical face and then work through fun holds through the long slab.
Short traverse on the backside of the main boulder. Start is the crux as the holds aren't as juggy. Good warm up route.
content.location: From the back of the main boulder, start on the far right side and traverse to the left arete where there is a small hole.

content.description:
When looking at the tall slab face (from the paved trail) to the low right you will find an undercut roof.

Sit start in the massive jug shelf below the roof. Reach out left to the juggy hole. Continue left toward the tall slab face to jugs. Top out on the lower section (not taking the the slab all the way to the top) and either downclimb a tree or hop down to a pad.

Start under the roof on the jug shelf as per "Murder She Wrote" but off the start climb right toward the shorter face above the roof (climbers right around the corner from the tall front slab face) to gain the slot at the lip. Mantle up the sloped face.

This is an excellent climb, but should be done on top rope or downclimbed with a static line. Anchors have been placed at the top of the boulder.

When facing the back vertical face, this problem climbs the well featured leaning left arete.

Set up a top rope at the anchors for this one.

When looking up at the boulder from the trail, this climbs up the middle-center of the tall slab face, ending at the apex of the boulder. Work your way up the short vertical face and then work through interesting features and underclings up the long slab.

A beauty of a climb on the back vertical face of the Greenway Boulder. Set up a top rope at the anchors or take a static line with you to descend safely.

Start about 8ft to the right of the left-most arete (Greenway Arete) and climb directly up through jugs low, into edges higher up for the most committing moves just below the lip.
